intro: Phaca pinosa, commonly known as the slender phaca, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers make it a distinctive member of the flora in its native habitat. Phaca pinosa is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate.
